body.p: Notwithstanding that the entity could cancel the contract (in which case the customer’s obligation to the entity would be limited to transferring control of the partially completed asset to the entity and paying the penalty prescribed), the entity has a right to payment for performance completed to date because the entity could also choose to enforce its rights to full payment under the contract. The fact that the entity may choose to cancel the contract in the event the customer defaults on its obligations would not affect that assessment (see paragraph B11 of IFRS 15), provided that the entity’s rights to require the customer to continue to perform as required under the contract (ie pay the promised consideration) are enforceable.
